title: A new partnership between McAvoy, Zadorov has Bruins defense regaining some bite
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Charlie McAvoy and Nikita Zadorov form a new defensive partnership for the Bruins, improving their defense significantly.
In the past three games, the Bruins allowed only one 5-on-5 goal with the McAvoy-Zadorov pairing.
The Bruins recorded a 2-1 win over Carolina, limiting their high-scoring offense with only one high-danger chance allowed.

title: How Jeremy Swayman responded after tweak in Bruins goalie rotation
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Jeremy Swayman allowed only one goal in his return, helping the Bruins secure a 2-1 win over Carolina.
Coach Marco Sturm considered rotating goalies after Swayman's 7-2 defeat against Ottawa, giving Joonas Korpisalo consecutive starts.
Swayman maintains a higher save percentage and goals saved above expected compared to Korpisalo this season.

title: 9 things to know about Red Sox’ situation entering MLB offseason
author: Conor Roche
bullets: MLB offseason starts Sunday; Red Sox free agents include Rob Refsnyder and Dustin May.
Trevor Story and Lucas Giolito have options for 2026, impacting the Red Sox's lineup decisions.
Red Sox linked to free agents like Kyle Tucker and pitchers Dylan Cease and Michael King.

title: CBS’s Jason McCourty has seen a lot of the Patriots this season, and even he didn’t see this level of success coming
author: Chad Finn
bullets: Jason McCourty will call his third Patriots game this regular season with CBS's No. 4 broadcast crew.
McCourty, along with Charles Davis and Andrew Catalon, previously covered Patriots wins over the Dolphins and Titans.
Patriots quarterback Drake Maye is a standout, contributing to the team's 6-2 record and MVP discussions.

title: Patriots reportedly targeting Dolphins pass rusher ahead of trade deadline
author: Conor Roche
bullets: The Patriots are reportedly targeting Dolphins edge rusher Jaelan Phillips ahead of the NFL trade deadline Tuesday.
Phillips has logged three sacks this season, ranking 11th in pressures and tied for 13th in pass-rush win rate.
Miami seeks at least a third-round pick for Phillips amid speculation following their general manager's departure.

title: Marco Sturm: Bruins’ Mason Lohrei should be angry after getting scratched again
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Mason Lohrei has not played in the Bruins' last three games despite his offensive potential.
Coach Marco Sturm believes Lohrei should use this as motivation and a learning opportunity.
The Bruins have improved defensively with Nikita Zadorov replacing Lohrei alongside Charlie McAvoy.

title: 5 things to know about Falcons before Sunday’s game vs. Patriots
author: Conor Roche
bullets: The Falcons enter Sunday's game with a 3-4 record, facing the Patriots' defense ranked 19th against the pass.
Falcons' running back Bijan Robinson leads the NFL with 137.4 scrimmage yards per game and excels as a dual-threat.
Falcons' defense ranks second in yards allowed per game, with standout secondary performance from A.J. Terrell and Xavier Watts.

title: Pair of former Red Sox save Dodgers to force Game 7 of World Series
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Mookie Betts and Kiké Hernandez helped the Dodgers defeat the Blue Jays 3-1, forcing a Game 7 in the World Series.
Betts hit a two-run single in the third inning, breaking out of a World Series slump and giving the Dodgers a lead.
Hernandez made a decisive play to end the game by catching a fly ball and throwing out a runner at second base.

title: Frights and delights: A look at some of Boston’s stand-out Halloween costumes
author: Morgan Rousseau
bullets: MBTA staff celebrated Halloween by distributing candy on the T, dressed as Wizard of Oz characters and a 'T princess'.
Boston Children’s Hospital hosted Boston Celtics' Jayson Tatum, who visited during Halloween festivities.
Local children wore fast food-themed costumes, including a Newton boy as McDonald's and siblings as 'DunKings'.

title: A winning Powerball ticket remains unclaimed in Mass. — and expires next month
author: Morgan Rousseau
bullets: A $50,000 winning Powerball ticket purchased in Marlborough, Mass., is unclaimed and expires on November 20, 2025.
The ticket was bought at New Capital Farms Convenience Store for the November 20, 2024, drawing.
Unclaimed prize funds are redistributed across Massachusetts cities and towns if not collected by the deadline.
